h1.div: Pathfinder will be closed until May 4th

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

p.a: Pathfinder COVID-19 Remote Learning Letter Click Here

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc
hJDwNd-AhqUyc-OiUrBf jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Commissioner Riley sent a message to superintendents on April 1 regarding changes to deadlines for non-resident students applying to Chapter 74 vocational technical schools:

li.strong: The deadline for parents to submit the non-resident student tuition application to the superintendent in their district of residence is extended from April 1 to May 1.
The deadline for the superintendent in the district of residence to approve or disapprove the application is extended from 10 days after receipt to 20 days after receipt.
The deadline for parents to request a DESE review of a superintendents non-approval is extended from May 1 to June 1.

div.p: In addition, the commissioner may grant additional time on a case-by-case basis for students & families directly impacted by the coronavirus pandemic. Parents may submit their non-resident student tuition application via email without signatures, as long as it contains all of the required information. Superintendents may also approve or disapprove using email without signatures. Anyone who needs additional information on this subject can email Marnie.A.Jain@mass.gov.
Supplemental online educational resources for parents and teachers

div.p: All Pathfinder Cooperative Education placements have been suspended until further notice.

h2.div: Click the Pathfinder "P" to APPLY NOW!

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-ibL1re purZT-AhqUyc-ibL1re pSzOP-AhqUyc-ibL1re jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque
hJDwNd-AhqUyc-EehZO jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

h2.div: We have celebrated over 40 years of providing quality technical education to the communities of Belchertown, Granby, Hardwick, Monson, New Braintree, Oakham, Palmer, Ware, and Warren.
During that period, we have grown to over 650 students, built a major addition, increased our offerings to include 16 fields, and broadened our service area to more than 25 communities.
We currently are a school of choice.

em.strong: "All students, regardless of race, color, sex, gender identity, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, or homelessness, have equal access to the general education program and the full range of any occupational or vocational programs offered by the district."

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

h3.div: Pathfinder RVTHS Sykes St. Palmer, MA 01069 P: 413-283-9701

hJDwNd-AhqUyc-OiUrBf jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

p.strong: Interested in applying to Pathfinder for the 2020-2021 school year? THERE'S STILL TIME!
Go to https://pathfinder.enrolltrack.com/StudentPortal/# to create your account and get started!

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-c5RTEf purZT-AhqUyc-c5RTEf pSzOP-AhqUyc-c5RTEf jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque
hJDwNd-AhqUyc-OiUrBf jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Applications for admission to Pathfinder for the 2020-2021 school year will be under review soon! We are gathering final documents and conducting phone interviews for students who do not yet have complete applications. We appreciate your patience and understanding as things are more challenging and taking longer than usual due to the closure of schools in our state. We are aiming to have letters about admissions decisions sent via email to applicants (who reside in our member towns) within the next couple of weeks. Out of district applications will be reviewed in the weeks to follow. Again, thanks for your patience. Stay safe!

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-II5mzb jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque
hJDwNd-AhqUyc-OiUrBf jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Click HERE to find out more about the FY21 budget!

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-c5RTEf purZT-AhqUyc-c5RTEf pSzOP-AhqUyc-c5RTEf jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque
hJDwNd-AhqUyc-Clt0zb jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Congratulations to Pathfinder senior Jacqueline Garvin for being recognized by the Zonta Club of Quaboag Valley with a Girl's Rocket Award at a ceremony held at Ludlow Country Club on January 13th. This award was given to six young women in the local community who have shown the tenacious spirit of Zontian Amelia Earhart in honor of the 100 year anniversary of Zonta International--a global organization whose mission is to empower women worldwide. Sharing in this celebration with Jackie was her parents, School Counselor Erica Dupre, School Adjustment Counselor Kate Connelly and Director of Guidance Brenda Turner. Guest speaker was Grace Gerhardt, a WPI Aerospace Engineering graduate, who is now employed by Pratt & Whitney. Jackie, a senior enrolled in Business Technology at Pathfinder, plans to attend Western New England University next fall to pursue International Business and Engineering. Congratulations Jackie!

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-c5RTEf purZT-AhqUyc-c5RTEf pSzOP-AhqUyc-c5RTEf jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque

div.p: Progress reports for the mid-point of Trimester 1 were distributed to students on Monday afternoon. Remember, these are progress notices and are not part of the student's permanent record. THE FIRST TRIMESTER CLOSES ON WEDNESDAY, NOVEMBER 27TH.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-II5mzb jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque
hJDwNd-AhqUyc-OwsYgb jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Just a reminder that tomorrow night (10/2/19) is Open House for families of current students! Our guest speaker will begin at 6:00 p.m. We hope to have a great turnout of parents & guardians!

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-c5RTEf purZT-AhqUyc-c5RTEf pSzOP-AhqUyc-c5RTEf jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque

div.p: SAVE THE DATE! Our annual Open House for parents of current Pathfinder 9-12 grade students will be held on Wednesday, October 2nd from 6:00-8:00 p.m. More details to follow shortly!

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-c5RTEf purZT-AhqUyc-c5RTEf pSzOP-AhqUyc-c5RTEf jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque

h3.div: Power School info going home today! (9/6/19)

div.p: Power School account set-up information for all 9th graders & parents will be going home with students today. Look for a pink letter!
